source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Lawrencia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Lawrencia. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves more than 5 mm long, ± ovate to obovate with crenate or serrate margins, not fascicled; indumentum of stellate hairs or plants glabrous, never spinescent
Leaves small (to c. 5 mm long) and narrow, covered in minute fringed peltate scales, borne in fascicles along twiggy, often divaricate and/or spinescent branches
Flowers sessile or subsessile, petals green or yellow, not or barely exceeding calyx; styles 5; mericarps glabrous
Flowers distinctly pedicellate, with white petals 6–12 mm long; styles 6–11; mericarps densely stellate-hairy
Leaves not rosetted, plants usually branched from base with flowers clustered along stems; stellate-pubescent plants of the north-west
Leaves rosetted at base of plant; inflorescence an erect, often unbranched leafy spike; glabrous, coastal or near-coastal plants
